TXT_Talk_Aliahan_House3_1F_BookShelf_1.Text:
{LEADER} examines the bookshelf.
Pinned to the side is a list of mini medal prizes...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_House1_1F_Event_MAIN_0_.Text: Our story begins on the morning of {HERO}'s sixteenth birthday...
Can't it wait until <IfGender_HERO(he's,she's,)> a little bit older?
*: It pains me to say that we have had no word from Ortega since he left for the volcano...
I'll go and wake them now.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_House1_2F_MAIN_0_SCENE_.Text: Morning, my darling! It's time to get up! Today's a very important day!
After all, it's not every morning you ask the king himself to give your big journey his personal blessing!
This is what I've been raising you for all these years!
Well then, shall we get going? Come on! Follow me!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_MAIN_0_SCENE_0010_0.Text: Come on, dear! You know where the castle is<--->straight on now!
Off you go, and remember to mind your manners! I won't have the king thinking you've been dragged up!
What in heaven's name are you doing, child? Off with you now and see the king!
And where exactly do you think you're going, hm? Have you changed your mind about going to meet the king?
Well you could have fooled me! Now stop being so silly, and run along to the castle. And BE POLITE!
Oh you have, have you? Well, if you don't go and see him today, he might never grant you an audience again.
Is that what you want? Well? Is it?
Well, if you're going to be like that, I shan't bother saying any more.
I'm off home, dear, but I'll ask you one last time before I go: are you sure you don't want to meet the king?
Alright then. You're old enough to make your own decisions. Far be it from me to stop you.
You do whatever you want, {HERO}. Just don't go getting into trouble, you hear?
Good. I should think so too. Now, off with you, and don't forget to be polite.

Alright then, I'll be off home.
Look after yourself, won't you? (sniff)

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Castle_2F_MAIN_0_VOLUME.Text: Well met, child of Ortega!
*: We could not locate any of Ortega's belongings.
I see... To think something out there is capable of besting a man of his calibre...
My husband thought long and hard before setting off. I'm sure he was at peace when he passed.
Doubtless, your mother has recounted the tale of your father's final moments many times.
When he fell into the maw of that accursed volcano, the world lost a great man.
However, we wholeheartedly approve of your wish to follow in his footsteps and set forth on the path of adventure.
For it is what he would have wanted. And only the child of such a hero as he could hope to save our world.
The foe we face is dire indeed<--->the Archfiend Baramos!
Many of the peoples of this world do not yet even know his name.
And yet, his grip on our realm grows ever tighter.
He must be stopped<--->no matter the cost!
You must free us from the Archfiend's ever-encroaching tyranny!
But alone, you will only meet the same fate as your father.
Go and consult with Mistress Patty in town. And use this to outfit the companions she has selected for you.
{HERO} receives 50 gold coins and some basic equipment, and puts them in the bag!
Allow me to proffer some guidance: you would be wise to seek out the thief's key, an implement that can open a myriad of the world's doors; obtain it and your travels will be that bit easier.
But first, I suggest you heed His Majesty's advice and seek like-minded individuals at Patty's Party Planning Place.
Once you have done so, try making your way to Reeve, a quaint village to the north-west of our fair kingdom.
You will now find Reeve marked on your map. Locating the rest of the realm's noteworthy areas, however, is a task I believe best left in your capable hands.
You simply need note down anywhere you happen to visit. Be sure to see these places with your own eyes first, though, otherwise you'll likely forget to mark them on your map.
And remember: your curiosity is an asset most valuable. Lend it an ear at all times and you will surely benefit. However, remain wary, lest it lead you into trouble on occasion...
We expect great things of you!
Ahh, so you have deigned to grace us with your presence at last. We had begun to think that you were not coming.
So, you are the child from all those years ago... You have grown.
You will not remember, but we have met once before.
It was on the day when we received word of your father's passing...
Ortega was a true hero of our realm. One of the greatest.
His loss came as a blow to us all...
Well, well... If it is not the child of the mighty Ortega!
...Who set off for adventure without the permission of their king, and with no companions!
So you have finally deigned to grace us with your presence...
No matter. It is not yet too late to begin your journey.
But the time to treat your quest with the gravity it deserves has arrived...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_MAIN_0_SCENE_0010_0.Text: *: Our hero has returned! All hail the hero, fresh from defeating the dastardly Baramos!

*: So peace really has returned at last?
Well, I'll be...
*: Thank you, {HERO}. Thank you so much. From all of us.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Castle_2F_MAIN_0_VOLUME.Text: Ohh, welcome home, my little champion! I'm so proud and happy, I could burst!
Ahh, if only your father could see you...
Just look at you. You've grown into a great adventurer. The spitting image of your father.
And I know, somewhere out there, he's just as chuffed as I am.
Well met indeed, vanquisher of the Archfiend Baramos!
Truly, you are your father's child! The kingdom<--->nay, the whole world<--->salutes you!
Well met indeed, vanquisher of the Archfiend Baramos!
That one such as you should topple such a fearsome tyrant as the Archfiend is miraculous indeed!
Truly, you are your father's child, and every bit his equal in prowess!
Such excellence demands recognition. Here! A gift, from your humbled king to you!
{HERO} is presented with a shiny new bastard sword!
Well met indeed, vanquisher of the Archfiend Baramos!
Truly, you are your father's child! And your companions, too, are touched with greatness! The kingdom<--->nay, the whole world<--->salutes you!
Servants! A feast must be prepared, the like of which our land has never seen!
Hm hm hm hm hm!
I must apologise for intruding on such a heartwarming scene!
I am Zoma. Master of darkness. Lord of the Underworld.
And so long as I will it, your realm shall never be free of the pall of night.
Now...suffer!
Your pain shall be my pleasure!

All shall know despair! All shall kneel!
All shall give their lives in sacrifice to my glory!
For I am Zoma, bringer of oblivion!
Obey, and your suffering shall be short! Resist, and you shall know true torment!

Hm hm hm hm hm!
HA HA HA HA HAAA!!!
*: Is everyone unharmed!?
*: What was that!?
No... It cannot be. Not now. Not when peace had finally returned to the land...
Will it forever remain beyond our reach...?
Everyone present, listen, and listen well:
My subjects must never learn of Zoma's existence.
Their lives have been ruled by unease for long enough...
Oh, Goddess... Which is the path I must take...? Ah, forgive me a moment of weakness. Now, please, leave me...
The appearance of Zoma, Lord of the Underworld, proved a rude awakening for {HERO} upon <IfGender_HERO(his,her,)> return to Aliahan.
However, as per the king's decree, the truth of the day's events was confined to those within the throne room.
Then, later that night, as the townspeople slept...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_House1_1F_MAIN_0_SCENE_.Text: What's the matter? Can't you sleep?
Suppose it's no surprise really; you've been through your fair share.
Ooh, just thinking of that horrible voice we heard in the castle sends shivers down my spine.
But enough of that. Tell me: do you know what you're going to do next?
Gosh, just listen to you. Your old mum couldn't be prouder...
It's alright. I'm still in shock too...
I had hoped this would be the end of it, but I know you can't just stay here. You're just like your father in that sense.
Oh, this all brings back memories of when he left Aliahan to go on his journey.
His friends presented him with the finest helmet you've ever seen...
Everyone came out to wish him well. They were all so joyous, but there was nothing but fear in my heart...
Oh, this is quite the helm indeed...
Can't it wait until <IfGender_HERO(he's,she's,)> a little bit older?
I just don't want to lose you too...
...Oh, I'm sorry. Don't worry, everything will be alright.
At any rate, I'd say it's well past your bedtime. Go on, you must be shattered. We can talk in the morning.
Morning, my darling!
I suppose it's that time again, eh?
I know there's no stopping you; just promise me you'll take care, alright?
And know I'll be here for you with open arms whenever you come home.
So, bye for now. Do pop by again if you ever find yourself missing my cooking!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_House1_1F_SUB_0_SCENE_0.Text: Welcome home, dear! Why, you certainly look the part today. Go on, let your mother have a<--->
I could never forget that helmet even if I tried.
It's still crystal clear in my memory, you know. The day your father's friends gave it to him for his journey.
*: Morning! Gosh, you must be bubbling with emotions now Ortega's departure is so close.
*: We know it's not much, but we got 'im a little somefink...
Oh, this is quite the helm indeed...
I can still see it. The fire in his eyes when he first donned that helmet.
But just look at it now...
Covered in scratches. Poor Ortega must've gone through so much...
Still, thank you for showing it to me. You should keep ahold of it; it's what your father would've wanted.
I mean it. I don't need his helm when I've already got so many wonderful memories.
And I imagine you'll need something to keep your head out of harm's way on your travels.
Now, how about we lighten the mood with some food? I'll make us something extra special.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_House1_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0.Text:
Oh, welcome home, muffin!
My dear, sweet {HERO}!
You must be worn out from all that running around! Come on now, off to bed with you!
What's that? Of course your little friends can stay too! The more the merrier! Goodnight, children!
Morning, darling! Go on now, off you go and do some adventuring!
Whatever's the matter, dear? Are you tired of adventuring?
Well, I'm sure you are. And Mummy would love to be with her darling {HERO} forever and ever.
But there comes a time when every child must fly the nest.
Now off you go! Get out there and make your father proud!
I should think not! Whatever would your father say?
Wh-What!? What's happened to {HERO}!?
Oh no... Don't say it... Don't say I've lost <IfGender_HERO(him,her,)> too! Living without Ortega was hard enough...but this?
Please, you have to help <IfGender_HERO(him,her,)>... Help my {HERO}... My only child...
Welcome back, my darling! So? Did you see the king? And were you nice and polite like you promised?
Thank goodness for that.
I was petrified you'd trip over or say the wrong thing, or...
Well, it doesn't matter now. You have the king's permission to go off adventuring! You're officially a grown-up!
You weren't? Oh dear... But then, it was your first time at court, wasn't it?
I mean, you can't be expected to make it through without a slip-up or two, can you, now?
Anyway, you must be ever so tired after all that excitement. Off to bed with you, sweetums!
Morning, darling! Go on now, off you go and do some adventuring!
Welcome back, dear. Are you still stubbornly avoiding the king and your duties?
You went? Even after everything you said?
Ohh, you have no idea how proud you've made your mother!
Anyway, you must be ever so tired after all that excitement. Off to bed with you, sweetums!
Now hold on just a moment, young <IfGender_HERO(man,lady,)>. Don't think you can fool me.
I know very well that you didn't go.
But I'm sure you have your reasons, so I shan't interfere.
Just don't go getting yourself into trouble, alright? Now be off with you.
Really? Are you really that determined not to meet him? Ohh, whatever are we going to do with you?
But I'm sure you have your reasons, so I shan't interfere.
Anyway, you must be ever so tired after all that excitement. Off to bed with you, sweetums!
Ohh, welcome home, my little champion! I'm so proud and happy, I could burst!
Ahh, if only your father could see you...
Eh? Where's my little champion, hm? What have you done with my {HERO}?
You tell that little rascal to get home, or there'll be trouble!
Anyway, just promise you'll look after yourself, alright? I'll be here for you if you ever need me.
Welcome home, dear! I was starting to wonder where you'd got to!
Haven't you finished with all that adventuring nonsense yet?
So it's still not over? Well then, I suppose your poor old mother will just have to wait patiently until you can finally come home.
I do hope my little champion is getting enough rest. You'll look after <IfGender_HERO(him,her,)>, won't you?
You tell that little rascal to come home from time to time, or there'll be trouble!
Welcome back, darling! Guess what? Your father's returned! Your father! He's alive!
Ohhh, I'm so happy, I could...
Look, darling! Look! It's your father! In the flesh!
He's alive! After all this time! Oh, I'm so, so, so happy, I could... Oh, look at me!

Unbelievable... <IfGender_HERO(His,Her,)> father returns from the dead, and <IfGender_HERO(he,she,)>'s not here to see it. Goddess willing <IfGender_HERO(he,she,)> comes home soon and we can be one happy family again.
Welcome home, my darling! I've been busy telling your father about everything that happened while he was away.
After all, there's a lot to tell!
So much so that I just can't stop talking! Ohh, me and my big mouth! Hee hee!
I just can't stop talking! We've got so much catching up to do! Hee hee!
You're the most heroic hero in the whole wide world! My own flesh and blood! Who'd have thought it? Well, me, obviously...
Like father, like <IfGender_HERO(son,daughter,)>, eh? Or, more importantly, like grandfather, like grand<IfGender_HERO(son,daughter,)>! Heh heh!
So, you're my little one, eh? It's the strangest thing: I know this is the first time I've laid eyes on you all grown up...
...yet I feel like we just met a short while ago.
You know what? Don't mind me. I think I'm just a bit tired.
So, you're my little one, eh? Well, not so little any more...
When I left, you were barely the size of my thumb, and now look at you!
And I'm sorry. I've put you through a lot...
So, what do you get up to with your time? ...What? You set out to follow in my footsteps and destroy the Archfiend?
Well, now. There's not much I can say to that, is there?
Just don't go making your mother worry too much, will you? She's been through enough already.
You've grown into a fine young adventurer, {HERO}.
I almost wish I could set out with you, but I couldn't do that to your poor mother.
Especially not after all that I've put her through already...
Well, I've done all I can. It's time to pick up where your old man left off, {HERO}.
And I'm sure you'll do me proud<--->you look like you could snap the Lord of the Underworld in two with one hand!
He seems to be lost in thought.
Ah, it's you, {HERO}. Good. There's something I've been meaning to ask you<--->it's about your mother...
Um, it's lovely of her to want to tell me everything that's been going on, but...is there a way of getting her to stop?
No? Well, I suppose I'll just have to grin and bear it, then. It is nice that she's so excited to see me, after all...
I'm not sure why, but it just occurred to me that I left something in a village by the name of Mur on my travels.
It's probably long gone at this point, but at the very least I'd like to go and thank them for looking after it.
Wait, that's it: my helmet! What are you doing with it?
Oh, don't worry about returning it. You'll get far more use out of it than I will.
That said, I don't remember it having quite so many scratches. There's an old friend of mine who could...
Ah, but there's hardly enough time for that, and it's still just about fit for purpose.
Honestly, just look at you, {HERO}...
In slaying Baramos you've already bested anything I ever accomplished.
Just know that I'm the proudest father there is, and nothing will ever change that.
What's more, you've still got your whole life ahead of you; who knows how you'll surprise us in the future.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_House1_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0.Text: Ortega was real hero material, you know. Your father was something special. And his father before him! Heh!
You've a lot to live up to, {HERO}<--->don't let your grandfather down!
Left <IfGender_HERO(his,her,)> friends to do the hard work while <IfGender_HERO(he,she,)> goes off gallivanting, no doubt...
Zzz... Ortega! Son... Why did you have to go and...? (sob) Zzz... Zzz...
Nothing quite like waking up to beautiful blue skies, is there, my <IfGender_HERO(boy,girl,)>?
Listen, you've more than earned the right to make your own decisions. I'll be behind you whatever choice you make.
Now go and show that brute what's what! Don't worry, I'll still be here when you get back.
Honestly, I think you've earned yourself the right to some rest, don't you? Get back to bed now.
That's my boy! Alive in spite of all the odds! That's powerful blood running through those veins<--->my blood! Heh!
I never dared even dream of this day! To see my <IfGender_HERO(grandson,granddaughter,)> and son reunited... How joyous!
Praise be to the Goddess for keeping him safe all this time.
Zzz... My own flesh and blood... Immortal... And all thanks to me... Zzz... Zzz...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_VOLUME_0010_0.Text: *: And exactly where do you think you're going? His Majesty awaits you in the throne room!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110_01.Text: *: This is the castle town of Aliahan, as you know.
*: If you're planning on heading out for a hike, you could do worse than visit the picturesque village of Reeve to the north-west.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110_02.Text: *: We've heard the news already<--->you beat Baramos! Hooray!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110_04.Text: *: Hey, you'll never guess what! Red-hot gossip<--->Ortega, hero of Aliahan is back from the dead! I knooow!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0210_01.Text: *: Time was, Aliahan ruled over all the world.
*: But then came the wars, and we lost so many of our young men...
*: They say it was the fighting which led them to close the teleportal to the mainland...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0210_02.Text: *: So you beat that blighter Baramos, did you? You really are a hero!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0210_03.Text: *: Did you feel the ground shake earlier on? I could have sworn I felt something...
*: Hm. Well, it was only a little tremor. Probably nothing...
*: No? Must be my old bones shaking...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0210_04.Text: *: It's the funniest thing... Baramos is gone, but...
*: I just don't feel like the world is at peace yet...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0210_05.Text: *: So Ortega was alive the whole time, the rascal? Well, well! There's a turn-up for the books!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0310_01.Text: *: The castle is closed at night-time. If you want to meet the king, you'll have to go there during the day.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0310_02.Text: *: I heard of a so-called <6>golden country<9> far away to the north of here, across the sea. Jipang, they call it. What I wouldn't give to see the place...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0310_03.Text: *: Go on, get over to the castle! The king probably can't wait to congratulate you!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0310_04.Text: *: I bet the king was over the moon, wasn't he?
*: Ha! Why am I even asking? Of course he was!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0310_05.Text: *: Baramos has definitely been defeated, hasn't he?
*: Yes, of course he has. So this feeling I have<--->like we're still in danger<--->I'm just being silly, aren't I?
*: Huh? But how can that be? The castle guards said they went to check, and it was definitely true...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0410_01.Text: *: On a nice, sunny day like this, the whole idea of the Archfiend destroying the world just seems impossible, doesn't it?

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0410_02.Text: *: So big, bad Baramos is gone, is he?
*: Do you think that means all the horrible monsters will go away too? I hope so. Then we could go outside and play.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0410_03.Text: *: I tried to go outside the city to play the other day.
*: But as soon as I got out there, I saw a huge, great, big stark raven, and I got scared and came back home.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0410_04.Text: *: Hey, Mr Ortega's back, isn't he? Everyone's talking about it!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0510_01.Text: *: If you leave town and wait a while, eventually it will get dark.
*: And when that happens, you want to be careful<--->the meaner monsters just love the night-time! If you get scared, find an inn and wait it out till morning.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0510_02.Text: *: If you leave town and wait a while, eventually it will get dark.
*: The meaner monsters just love the night-time! If you get scared, find an inn and wait it out till morning.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0510_03.Text: *: Now we can all live happily and peacefully ever after!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0510_04.Text: *: It's weird, isn't it? The Archfiend has gone, but there are still monsters all over the place.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0610_01.Text: *: Have you seen that funny little island off to the west of town?
*: Well, the building standing on it is known as the Dreamer's Tower. And a strange old place it is too...
*: Walk a little way west of town, and you'll spot it soon enough.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0610_02.Text: *: I could swear I've been hearing voices drifting up out of the well for a while now.
*: You don't think there's somebody trapped down there, do you?

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0610_03.Text: *: What's that? You beat Baramos? The Archfiend? Well now, that really is something!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0710_01.Text: *: 'Ello, 'ello, 'ello! I'm your local guardsman on the beat, 'ere to keep the streets free of trouble!
*: You may set off on your quest, safe in the knowledge that your 'ometown is in good 'ands!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0710_02.Text: *: But without Baramos to worry about, what will we guardsmen do with ourselves?

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0710_03.Text: *: Now that Ortega's back, we've got nothing to fear in the whole wide world!
*: Even if a horde of monsters attacks the town, he'll send them packing, and be done in time for breakfast!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0820_01.Text: *: Ah! You're the young fellow I met over at Patty's place, aren't you?
*: Ah! You're the young lady I met over at Patty's place, aren't you?
*: Well, whoever you are, just look at that moon! Here's to it! Cheers! (glug glug) Hic!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0820_02.Text: *: Wassat? You beat big, bad Baramos?
*: Bully for you! You must be<--->Hic!<--->breathtakingly, um...blissful. BURP! Heh heh... Hic!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0820_03.Text: *: Cor, lookathat! Look! You! Oi<--->Hic<--->lookadit! The moon! It's flipping<--->Burp!<--->beautiful! Hahahahaha!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0820_04.Text: *: Wassat? Yeah, turns out Ortega wasn't dead after all. Who'd have<--->Hic!<--->thunk it?

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0920_01.Text: *: I'm afraid I've shut up shop for the day. Why don't you get some sleep, then come back and see me tomorrow?

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1020_01.Text: Well now, we are up late, aren't we? But you're still in one piece, that's the main thing.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1210_01.Text: *: Let us pray for peace. Even if it brings us only one day closer to salvation, it will be worthwhile.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1210_02.Text: *: The peoples of the world are safe, and no words can express our gratitude. Goddess bless you, my child.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1210_03.Text: *: Though the Archfiend is defeated, I cannot help but feel a certain trepidation still. I pray that my instincts are wrong...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1310_01.Text: *: Sounds like they're holding a feast in the castle to celebrate the fall of the Archfiend.
*: Have to say, I'm more than a bit jealous of your mum and grandfather getting invited; they must be beyond proud of you!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1410_01.Text: *: Have you ever looked in a pot or a barrel? You can find all sorts of stuff if you're lucky. Things people have thrown away, things they've put in there and forgotten about...
*: Honestly, my mum's always telling me to tidy up and meanwhile grown-ups are just chucking their things in pots and barrels. Lucky them<--->they've got me to clean up their mess, at least!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1510_01.Text: *: You ever heard of Kirk Buzzer? People call him a master thief, but he's nothing more than a burglar who steals from people's wardrobes and drawers.
*: A nuisance is what he is, and his behaviour sets a terrible example for the children. Not like you, though<--->our paragon of truth and justice!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1610_01.Text: *: That reminds me, I should check in on that odd bloke I found in that well once...
*: Some of my fellow guards mentioned they had been paying him visits from time to time, but I'd love to know what he's actually up to down there.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Luida_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_01.Text: Welcome to Patty's Party Planning Place, where the adventurers of the world come together!
Wait just a second. It's little old {HERO}! Aw, look at you all dressed up in your adventuring gear.
Hang on... You're not playing around, are you? You're actually going out there...
Might be a good idea to go see the king first. I heard he wants to give your journey his royal blessing.
Naturally, I'll be more than happy to help once you've seen His Majesty, so do come back later, alright?
Hey, you. Still can't believe this day's finally here...
I remember when you popped out of your mother like it was yesterday, you know.
Oh, and don't be thinking I'm ridiculously old or anything; I was just a kid back then, but it felt like I suddenly had a new sibling to look after.
To think that was sixteen whole years ago...
At any rate, I'm sure you know by now, but Patty's Party Planning Place is your one-stop shop for all things adventuring.
If you find yourself feeling lonely on the road, or simply want some muscle you can count on in a pinch, let me know! I'll find the perfect companions to suit your needs.
But, gosh, you really are all grown up now, aren't you? May take me a while to get used to... At any rate...
{HERO}! I knew you'd do it, but I still can't quite believe you actually took down Baramos.
You know, something tells me business is about to start booming and it's all thanks to you!
But forget that; have you been to see the king yet? He's going to want to throw a banquet in your honour, I know it!
Hey there.
I heard all about what went on in the castle. You must be all shook up right now... Still crazy to think Baramos was just someone's lackey...
Oh, no need to look so surprised: I know about Zoma too. My sources never let me down.
In fact, I reckon it's high time I told you exactly how my Party Planning Place came to be.
You see, when the king heard of your father's passing, he couldn't let go of the fact that it was him who sent Ortega off with no help.
That drove His Majesty to create a spot where adventurers could meet, exchange ideas and form parties.
Anyway, this is what got built.
I did my part too: called in some favours and got the first few adventurers through the door. Then the king used his coffers to summon some more.
As time passed, this place grew into the bustling hub you know today. Gotta say, when you came in here on your birthday, I got a bit emotional.
Honestly, if the Party Planning Place has helped you out even a little bit, then I'd be happier than a slime on Sunday.
Oh, and don't worry: no one here's timid enough to get scared off by someone who calls himself <6>lord<9> of anything. I can promise you that.
Patty's Party Planning Place is still here for you just like it's always been. And that's never going to change.
I just heard the news about Ortega. You must be over the moon! Oh, I'm so happy for you.
Boy, you should've seen the king's face when he heard. Now that was a sight! He was smiling from ear to ear!
Brought a smile to my face too seeing him so happy again.
<1>Course, I'm delighted to have Ortega back too. He was always such a gentleman to me when I was a little girl.
Just thinking about it really takes me back... I used to adore listening to tales of all the adventures he went on.
Every time I heard he'd come back to town I'd go pester him to tell me all about his latest trip.
Then, one day, I asked if he could teach me how to wield a blade.
I wasn't quite strong enough for a broadsword or anything like that, so I had him show me how to use a dagger.
I know I wouldn't be nearly so fleet of foot if it hadn't been for his help. He taught me so much...
And I still make use of everything I learned to this day!
How exactly? Well, you know, my dagger skills come in handy in the kitchen and I serve tables quicker than anyone!
Oh, did you think I was going out there in my spare time slaying monsters? Ha, sorry to burst your bubble.
No, I've got my hands full just looking after this place and all the adventurers who walk through its doors.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Luida_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_02.Text: *: Wossat? Need a key, do ya? Come to fink o' it, I once knew a bloke who 'ad a knack for openin' doors. Went by the name <6>Kirk Buzzer<9>.
*: 'Aven't seen 'im in a good while, mind you. Not since 'e 'eaded off for that tower on the island west o' 'ere.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Luida_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_03.Text: *: If you're looking to put together a good solid party, you'll want a warrior, a priest and a mage.
*: If Patty over there doesn't have what you're looking for, head upstairs and get the recruitment people to find it for you.
*: Hello there! Come and have a drink with me! I know how tasty a nice glass after a hard day's adventuring can be!
*: When I was your age, I used to go round with a martial artist, a thief and a priest, you know. Lovely bunch...
*: Well, apart from the priest, that is. Terrible, selfish fellow, he was... Never healed anybody...
*: Come to mention it, you look like a pretty selfish sort yourself, {WORD}. I can see it in your face. Oop! Forget I spoke!
*: Hey, have you heard? Ortega's alive, and he's back in town!
*: If he's planning on heading out on another adventure, I'll be first in line to sign up!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Luida_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_05.Text: *: Oh bother! I left my bag hanging on the wall of my room at the inn!
*: And it had all my gold coins and herbs in it. Gah, it's probably long gone...
*: Well, nothing I can do about it now. If someone has swiped it, I hope they put my things to good use at least.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Luida_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_06.Text: *: You can never have too many <Plr_I_NAME> if you ask me. Being able to fly to places you've been before in the blink of an eye is so magical. In fact...it probably is magic...
*: Back in the dark old days you used to bump your head on the ceiling if you tried to use one indoors, but now you don't have to worry about any of that! Modern comforts, eh?

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Luida_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_07.Text: *: You know, I found fifty gold coins on a bench the other day. Felt like the Goddess Herself had smiled on me!
*: Ever since then I make a point of checking my surroundings wherever I go<--->never know when I'll strike it rich again, after all!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Luida_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_01.Text:
*: Welcome to Premiere Adventurer Listing Services! With PALS, you're sure to build a winning team!
We provide recruitment solutions to party leaders with royal approval.
*: Now, let me see... {HERO}, was it? One moment...
*: Ahh, I'm sorry. I can see here that you haven't been cleared to begin adventuring yet.
*: I'll need you to pop along and see the king, and then come back once all the paperwork's been put through...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Luida_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_02.Text:
*: Well, you've got your martial artists<--->they're quick as you like...
Then there's your thieves<--->good for treasure hunting, obviously...
*: Then, of course, there's merchants. They can appraise your items for you, which is pretty useful...
*: Don't go anywhere near the gadabouts, though. Useless lot, they are, always mucking about in battles. Bunch of clowns, if you ask me...
*: If you insist on having one along, leave it until you're strong enough to carry some serious dead weight.
*: We expected no less of you, son of Ortega! We have witnessed the birth of a true hero!
*: We expected no less of you, daughter of Ortega! We have witnessed the birth of a true hero!
*: Looks like you're more than tough enough to carry a gadabout these days. Why don't you give one a chance? Could be fun...
*: Blimey... So miracles really do happen...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Luida_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_03.Text:
*: ♪ Ohhh, if heroes are chosen by heaven itself,
Then sages are chosen by gods! ♪

*: ♪ Through tri-als most fearsome and bad for the health,
They'll make it 'gainst all of the odds! ♪

*: ♪ So let them sing across the laaand,
A hero here before us staaands! ♪

*: ♪ Oh, his name is Ortega, his sword strong and true...
And death cannot take him, yes he lives anew!
Shilderee-daldero-daaay! ♪

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Luida_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_05.Text: *: If you ask me, there's two kinds of adventurer in this world: those that include conjurers like mages and priests in their parties, and those that don't.

*: The ones that don't tend to go all out and fill their parties with warriors, martial artists and even merchants<--->vocations that focus on strength and stamina. Personally, I'd go for a more balanced line-up if I were you.
*: And if you really don't want to include any magic users, then why not take a monster wrangler or thief along for the ride?

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Luida_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_06.Text: *: When I was a young whippersnapper, I made a point of stopping by the shops whenever I visited a new town. I used to love perusing the merchants' wares...

*: Now, an adventurer such as yourself will want to focus on the weapons and armour<--->if you're blessed in the strength department, get yourself a trusty weapon. Otherwise, concentrate on defensive gear.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Luida_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_07.Text: *: Monster wranglers are a special bunch, that's for sure...
*: They ain't especially strong, and they definitely ain't much in the magic department neither, but they don't play by the rules<--->and that's what makes 'em so useful.
*: I 'appen to know a fair few adventurers out there that've benefited more than once from their 'ealin' abilities.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Luida_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_08.Text: *: I've no idea who invented bags, but whoever did was a genius. Truly, how did we ever carry our possessions around without them?
*: That said, they're not much use during battles. You won't have time to reach into yours for items if you're preoccupied showing a slime what's what.
*: No, if there's something you think you'll need in a fight, best to keep it on your<--->or a companion's<--->person!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Church_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0.Text: *: Aliahan sits upon a body of land surrounded entirely by the sea.
*: On the other side of that sea are land-masses larger than we island-dwellers could ever imagine.
*: Ahh, if I could only catch a glimpse of those distant shores just once before I die...
*: What's that? You beat Baramos? The Archfiend? Well now, that really is something!
*: Well now, you're <IfSolo(the one,that lot)> who...you know...aren't you? Thanks for that, <IfSolo(my dear,my dears)>! We owe you!
*: Oh, thank the heavens! Ortega is back with us safe and sound!
*: Does the Goddess really listen to the prayers of little old ladies like me!?
*: I think he's an absolute dreamboat, so I've been praying like mad that he'd come back!
*: Oops! Did I say that out loud? Hee hee!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_WeaponShop_1F_SUB_0_ACT.Text:
*: You're Ortega's <IfGender_HERO(son,daughter,)>, aren't you?
The hero?

*: Your father was a great man.
A truly great man.
*: I heard that the child of Ortega has set off on some kind of quest.
*: I hope they'll become as brave and gallant a hero as their father.
*: Well, if it isn't Ortega's son, the hero.
*: Well, if it isn't Ortega's daughter, the hero.
*: News of the deeds of Ortega's heroic offspring has reached us even here in Aliahan!
*: We expected no less of you, son of Ortega! We have witnessed the birth of a true hero!
*: We expected no less of you, daughter of Ortega! We have witnessed the birth of a true hero!
*: Oh, it's you! Feels like I haven't seen you for ages!
*: What? A world underground? I'm sorry, I haven't got the foggiest idea what you're on about.
*: I've just seen Ortega for the first time in an age, and he's looking bigger and stronger and nobler and more handsome than ever!
*: Look at you! What a shining, strutting paragon of heroism!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Inn_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0220.Text: *: Have you ever looked in a pot or a barrel? You can find all sorts of stuff if you're lucky. Things people have thrown away, things they've put in there and forgotten about...
*: Honestly, my mum's always telling me to tidy up and meanwhile grown-ups are just chucking their things in pots and barrels. Lucky them<--->they've got me to clean up their mess, at least!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Inn_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110.Text: *: Seems the fellow in the room opposite tried to make himself a wrecking ball and met with a little accident.
*: I was just enjoying some peace and quiet when suddenly an almighty bang came from his room!
*: Judging by how badly he's hurt, those things must be pretty dangerous...
*: I bet there are other people out there besides the man in the room opposite who have tried to make wrecking balls.
*: The only way to find out is to get out and look for them. It's a big, wide world out there!
*: Now we can all live happily and peacefully ever after!
*: The man in the room next door's wounds have finally healed, apparently.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Inn_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0210.Text: *: I, I... I only wanted to see what's on the other side of the...ocean... (cough) Ow... It 'urts...
*: I still can't flippin' believe it! Ortega! 'Ome at last! Not dead nor nuffink! I knew 'e was 'ard, but that bloke's sumfink else!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Inn_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0320.Text:
*: ♪ Good evening my friend, and yes, how do you do?
Will you be sojourning in this room here too? ♪

*: Wait<--->did we not make one another's acquaintance today at Patty's?
♪ Ohh, well met on this magical moonlit eve, frieeend...
I pray our companionship never shall eeend! ♪

*: ♪ How strange and mysterious, how funny, how odd...
A single I booked, I would swear to the gods!
Oddedy-doddedy-dee! ♪

*: ♪ Alas and alack, oh but this cannot be,
Such things are forbidden in this fair country!
Foldera-doldera-doo! ♪
*: ♪ Oh, his name is Ortega, his sword strong and tru<--->! (cough cough)
*: Alas, it seems I have sung myself hoarse! Verily, my song shall ring forth no longer this day! Thank you, and goodnight!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_House2_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0.Text: *: What are you after at this time of night, hm?
*: So someone we thought was dead has come back?
*: I suppose that must be somebody somewhere's way of telling us never to give up hope.
*: Should you be out this late? Won't your poor mother be worried sick?
*: What on earth has happened to dear, sweet {HERO}? Oh... Oh my...
*: We can all sleep soundly now, safe in the knowledge that Baramos has been defeated. Thank you so, so much.
*: I'll tell you one thing about that Ortega...
*: His wife is the luckiest woman in the world!
*: The night-time is all scary and dark! I hate it, I hate it, I hate it!
*: Hey, I should go to sleep, shouldn't I? Then when I wake up, it will be morning! Clever me! Hee hee!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_House3_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0.Text: *: He may not look it, but the boss here is a very important man. Get into his good books, and you won't regret it.
*: Heaven knows why, but when I met the boss here, I got this strange feeling that he was a king, and that I had to protect him.
*: That's why I followed him down here, you see.
*: It just feels like he's the kind of big shot the Archfiend or someone might want to bump off, you know?

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Castle_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0.Text: *: I owe Ortega more than words can say.
*: So if you ever happen to get the urge to do something...naughty, you can count on me to turn a blind eye...
*: I owe Ortega more than words can say.
*: So if his son's friends ever happen to get the urge to do something...naughty, you can count on me to turn a blind eye...
*: So if his daughter's friends ever happen to get the urge to do something...naughty, you can count on me to turn a blind eye...
*: We expected no less of you, son of Ortega! We have witnessed the birth of a true hero!
*: We expected no less of you, daughter of Ortega! We have witnessed the birth of a true hero!
*: Take as much as you like! Go on, knock yourself out!
*: ...Ah. Um, sorry, but it looks like they're all empty.
*: The throne room is just up the stairs there.
*: Off you go now, the king is waiting for you.
*: We heard loud noises coming from upstairs. Did something happen?
*: Whatever it was, something's got you looking glum.
*: Listen, everyone knows you beat Baramos already. So here's a word of advice: enjoy your success<--->you've earned it!
*: Well, as long as you're sure everything's okay...
*: Off you go now, the king is waiting for you.
*: That rascal Kirk Buzzer, who was robbing houses all over town, has finally got his just deserts<--->he's banged up in jail! Hahaha!

*: ♪ So let them sing across the laaand,
A hero here before us staaands! ♪
*: It's funny. You'd think the king would be happy that Baramos had been defeated, but he looks gloomier than ever.
*: But then I suppose he's probably worried sick about Zoma now. Hard to blame him really...
*: I heard from someone that there's a dragon up in heaven who can make wishes come true.
*: Do you believe something like that could really exist?
*: Yes, it's much more fun to believe it's true, isn't it?
*: Hmm. You're probably right...
*: Hold it right there, you dirty, rotten thief!
*: ...Oh. It's you. What are you doing here? It's the middle of the night! Come back in the morning, will you?
*: Welcome to Aliahan Castle!

*: Quickly now, go up and see the king!
He's waiting for you!
*: Welcome to Aliahan Castle!
*: I'm afraid His Majesty has already retired for the night.
*: Welcome to Aliahan Castle!
*: You're {HERO}, correct? We've been expecting you.

*: Quickly now, go up and see the king!
He's waiting for you!
*: Welcome to Aliahan Castle!
*: You're {HERO}, correct? We've been expecting you.
*: Why don't you go down to the inn and get yourself a room until morning, hm?
*: I hear that wily thief Kirk Buzzer came up with a key that could open any normal lock in existence!
*: Why, with one of those in your pocket, you could come and go through the doorways of the world as you pleased!
*: They say there's more keys out there in the world than just the thief's key, you know.
*: If you had the lot of them, why, you could go wherever you pleased!
*: So you beat that blighter Baramos, did you? You really are a hero!
*: Well now, you're <IfSolo(the one,that lot)> who...you know...aren't you? Thanks for that, <IfSolo(my dear,my dears)>! We owe you!
*: So Ortega's back with us, is he? Then peace will surely follow close behind!
*: I've been working here in Aliahan Castle for ten years now.
*: I wanted to become a royal scholar, but I failed the blessed exam.
*: I heard those who passed were given a special book that made them extra clever, too. Curse my luck...
*: Hooray for our hero, {HERO}!
*: Om nom nom nom nom! Mm-mm! The food tastes extra good today!
*: I've heard that the cave over on the promontory leads to the Dreamer's Tower. How about that?
*: I mean, I've never actually checked to see if it's true, but everyone says so.
*: I've heard that the cave over on the promontory leads to the Dreamer's Tower. How about that?
*: And that's not all<--->there's a secret passage beneath the castle here that leads to the cave. How about that?
*: What? You knew that already? Hmph. Spoilsport...
*: Hooray for our hero, {HERO}!
*: Hello there, {LEADER}. Not hanging up your travelling shoes just yet, then? Well, good luck out there.
*: Hooray for Ortega! Wooooo!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Castle_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_1.Text: *: Seems the wrecking ball is basically an explosive. They use it to blow through walls and such...
*: Hm? Knew that already, did you? Sorry I couldn't tell you something more useful...
*: Thanks to you, being a travelling merchant just got a lot less dangerous. I owe you one!
Those thtupid grown-upth won't let me go outthide because they thay it'th too dangerouth!
It'th that thmelly old Archfiend's fault, isn't it? Oooh, I hate him! It'th THO boring being cooped up in here!
I tried to thneak out the other day, but Daddy caught me.
He's much more pertheptive than he lookth...
I'm thtill not allowed outthide to play, even though Baramoth has been defeated! It'th not fair!
I think Daddy's jutht being thpiteful! He wantth me to thtay cooped up in here forever!

*: Have you seen the princess?
Princess! Princeeess!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Castle_1F_Out_SUB_0_ACT.Text: *: Oh! Hello there! You didn't come all this way just to see me, did you?
*: Oh. So you just happened here by accident, then? And there I was getting all excited...
*: I know you're lying, but it's very lovely of you to do so. Let me tell you something nice in return.
*: Apparently, they used to have a thing called a teleportal off on the east side of our little continent.
*: But it's all sealed up now so nobody can use it.
*: They said that the hero Ortega set off on his quest from the teleportal that used to be off to the east of here.
*: I wonder where it led... Ohh, I'm so jealous that he got to find out!
*: No more Baramos to worry about! Ooh, it's like a dream, isn't it? Somebody pinch me!
*: It's been a while now since Baramos was defeated, hasn't it?
*: To be honest, things are a bit dull nowadays. But this is the great peace we all dreamed of. Can't complain...
*: Yay! You came all the way back to see me again! I'm so happy!
*: ...What's that? Ortega's alive? No way! That's amazing!
*: I actually knew that already. I just wanted to be nice because you were kind enough to tell me. Thank you...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Castle_1FA_SUB_0_ACTOR_.Text: *: I recall reading somewhere that the seal placed on the teleportal could be broken by means of a wrecking ball.
*: Someone was researching wrecking balls, weren't they...? Ah, yes, of course! It was that old fellow from Reeve!
*: I wonder what form of being the Archfiend Baramos could be...
*: Just what manner of being was the Archfiend Baramos, I wonder...
*: The rumbling we felt earlier on was no ordinary tremor...
*: I hope nothing sinister is afoot...
*: According to my research, there is a place known as the Pit of Giaga on the land-mass to the north-west of here.
*: It seems there is a dark secret associated with it, although I have been unable to discover what it might be...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Castle_1FB_SUB_0_ACTOR_.Text: *: It was Ortega who inspired me to enlist as a castle guard, you know...
*: And yet, he went off to battle the enemy, and never returned...
*: I just can't believe he would let himself get killed so easily.
*: He's out there somewhere, I just know he is.
*: Now Ortega can rest in peace at last...
*: Well, if it isn't the mighty {LEADER}! Welcome! It's an honour.
*: Is it true that Ortega's alive, and that he's come home? Amazing!
*: Do you think he'll pay us a visit here at the castle? It'd be good to see him after all this time.

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Castle_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0.Text: No... It cannot be. Not now. Not when peace had finally returned to the land...
Our realm shall never be free of the pall of night...? What could it mean?
{MOST_HEROIC}... You must speak not a word of this to anyone.
Now, I grow tired. Leave me...
Brave {LEADER}... Only you can save us from Zom<--->
No. I cannot ask such a thing. Forget that I spoke...
Now, I grow tired. Leave me...
I have heard the news, {HERO}. Ortega has returned. Against all the odds, your father is home at last.
I sent word that he should report to the castle, but I expect that he is fatigued after his ordeal.
Tell him that he must rest. I shall receive him whenever he is ready.
I bid you go forth and eliminate Baramos! ...But perhaps you would wish to know more of the vile fiend before you slay him.
The Archfiend is thought to have unleashed the litany of monsters that currently vex our realm so. He is their leader, as it were.
I know not what foul form he assumes, for no human has ever laid eyes upon him and lived to tell of the horror, let alone returned with word of his whereabouts.
His name is only known to us due to monsters being wont to scream it whilst in their death throes.
I truly hope you are able to find Baramos and free us from his terror at long last. Goddesspeed, {HERO}!
Very well. Then I wish you Goddesspeed. The hopes of this world rest upon your shoulders.
The lofty spire on the small island west of Aliahan is known as the Dreamer's Tower.
It is seemingly inhabited, though by whom I could not say, and it is accessible via a certain passage.
To find it, head west from Aliahan until the tower comes into view, then simply follow the coast and you will soon arrive at the entrance.
The land to the east is virtually uninhabited, though a pristine spring bubbles away within one of the forests over there.
Not far from said spring lies the entrance to an ancient ruin that has stood there since the days of yore.
The only way to enter the ruin proper is with a certain object made by an older gent in the village of Reeve...
Ah, so you have obtained a wrecking ball, I see.
With that you may remove the obstruction that prevents one from entering the Path of Promise.
As you may know, the Path lies far to the east of here, past the village of Reeve and the mountains beyond.
The journey will no doubt be fraught with peril, so I beseech you to prepare accordingly.
{LEADER}, you are about to embark on a journey of immense import, yet the path forward may not always be clear.
Should you find your progress hindered or if the task before you seems insurmountable, head to the nearest settlement and seek an audience with their ruler.
Remember this well, for the world is a vast place and your quest is far from a simple one.
Though I am king, my knowledge is limited. The rulers of other lands will surely know much that may be of use to you.
Ah, well met {LEADER}. I understand you have acquired a fine ocean-going vessel. This is a promising development indeed.
Alas, I regret to inform you I am no closer to learning of Baramos's whereabouts... Though I remain positive he will not escape us for much longer.
Remember that the most unlikely sources may reveal vital information. Any clue, no matter how trivial it may seem, is worth investigating.
Furthermore, should you come into possession of rare curios with no obvious use, do not cast them aside. Their purpose may only become apparent in the most unexpected of places.
{LEADER}, I have information of great value. I must apologise for not telling you at an earlier juncture, but know that it is because I had your own safety at the forefront of my mind.
It concerns Ortega... His pursuit of Baramos all those years ago took him to a distant continent many leagues to the west, where he attempted to scale a volcano.
If any clue as to Baramos's whereabouts is to be found, it will be in the vicinity of that fiery peak.
However, as we know only too well, Ortega never did return... This can mean but one thing: the area is far from hospitable. Promise your king that you will take care.
At last, the name of Aliahan resounds across the world once more! This is truly an auspicious day!
My apologies, but even the king's considerable energy must be replenished from time to time.
I hope that I may be of service to you in his stead.
After all, the royal court must carry on, business as usual. We cannot risk sowing unease amongst the populace.
So Ortega, who we had thought lost, is returned to us! This is truly an auspicious day!
Perhaps I might consult with him about the issue of Zoma, Lord of the Underworld...
His Majesty has still not reached a decision. I fear it weighs upon his mind most heavily...
If only to ease his burden, I will take his place for a short while.
It is far too dangerous out in the wild to travel alone.
You must visit Patty's Party Planning Place in the west of town and recruit some companions.
Of course, even if you do find the thief's key, you must resist the urge to use it to poke your nose where it is not wanted<--->in people's houses, for example.
I say this as it was once in the possession of a reprobate by the name of Kirk Buzzer. He used it to get up to all manner of mischief.
Thankfully, he now resides in the castle jail, atoning for his transgressions. Naturally, I do not expect an upstanding youth such as yourself to follow in his foolish footsteps.
Now, should you ever find yourself unsure where to go next on your journey, call in at the nearest town. The locals might know something of use to you.
Even the most frivolous rumour could contain a vital clue, leading you one step closer to vanquishing the Archfiend.
And where better to hear such talk than the local watering hole or inn! Frankly, anywhere people gather is well worth a visit.
*: This should go without saying, but weapons and armour are no good to you if you forget to equip them.
*: But of course, you're the archetypal {WORD}, aren't you, {HERO}? You'd never make a schoolboy error like that.
*: I've heard you're quite the {WORD}, {HERO}, but you still need to be careful not to make silly mistakes.
*: Sorry. I don't mean to get all preachy.
*: I just worry about the biggest {WORD} I ever met setting off into the world alone, you know?
*: The further forward a person is in battle, the more likely they are to get hit by attacks.
*: That's why you always need to think very carefully about your party's line-up.
*: You may be the biggest {WORD} in town, but not even you can survive on your own, {HERO}.
*: You {WORD} types are likeable sorts, so I'm sure your companions will be happy to stand where you tell them to.
*: You'll just have to suppress the {WORD} within you and learn to get on with people. No fighting with your friends, alright?
*: But I hardly need to tell you that. Like every other {WORD}, you're nothing if not a people person!
*: You're carrying everyone's hopes on your shoulders. We're all counting on you to be a hero, {HERO}, so don't let us down.
*: If you're here to see the king, just carry on straight down this way.
*: Well, if it isn't the mighty {LEADER}! Welcome! It's an honour.
*: Go on then, in you go and see the king.

*: ♪ Oh, head west from the castle, and follow the sea...
And the promont'ry cave is where you shall soon be!
Fildedee-rildedee-day! ♪

*: ♪ Well, the king he doth ever and daily declare...
That the hero of Aliahan shall cure our despair!
Dum-da-daa-dum-da-daa-dummm! ♪
*: Oh, please, brave hero! Bring peace back to our world! You're our only hope!
*: Until the day when the hero of Aliahan brings peace back to our world...
*: We will be here, waiting... Hoping... Praying...
*: Quickly now, go in and see His Majesty!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Castle_B1FA_SUB_0_ACTOR.Text:
*: This is the castle dungeon. If you're here to visit a prisoner, just go up to the bars of their cell and talk to them.
But no funny business, understand?
*: You ain't got a key'll open this door, 'ave ya? Well then sling yer 'ook! I ain't got no use for ya!
*: A jailbreak, is it? Blindin'! Ta! 'Ere, let me give yer a bit of 'ot gossip by way of thanks.
*: Word is that the Dragon Queen 'erself lives in some shrine in the middle o' nowhere. But you didn't 'ear that from me, right?
*: So Ortega's alive, is 'e? Crikey! They don't make 'em like that no more!
That wrinkly old geezer up that Dreamer's Tower is a right piece o' work!
Not only did 'e go and get me banged up, 'e pinched me precious key, an' all! Me! The great Kirk Buzzer 'imself!
Me trusty thief's key'll open any red door in the world. If only I'd've used it to... Gah, what a plonker I am!
Bleedin' 'eck! You've only gone an' got yer 'ands on me precious thief's key!
Opens any red door, it does. If only I'd've used it to... Gah, what a plonker I am!
Lovely bit o' craftsmanship, that, even if I do say so meself. Yeah, made it with these fair 'ands, I did... Look after it, eh?
Don't go thinkin' the great Kirk Buzzer'll end 'is days rottin' in a cell.
Nah, I'll organise the jailbreak o' the century<--->and without the 'elp o' the likes o' you!
What does a pipsqueak like you want with the great Kirk Buzzer, eh? Pff. Whatever. Listen, and listen good...
That dragon up in 'eaven<--->if you ask nice, he'll grant a wish every time you go an' see 'im, or so they say.
Which means ya don't 'ave to worry about wastin' 'em! You can go wish wild! Heh heh!

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Castle_B1FA_SUB_0_VOLUM.Text: {LEADER} calms the monster with a soothing voice and tells it about Monty's monster menagerie...

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Castle_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_1.Text: *: {LEADER}, have you familiarised yourself with the jail below the castle? There's a rather unusual inmate down there: a slime, as it happens. Goddess knows what they did to end up there...
*: {LEADER}, have you familiarised yourself with the jail below the castle? A slime is being held there...<--->was being held there...I think. Did I imagine the whole thing?

TXT_Talk_Aliahan_Castle_B1FB_SUB_0_ACTOR.Text: *: I'm sorry, but entry to the castle is strictly forbidden after hours.
*: Could you please make your way to the nearest exit? Thank you.

*: What are you doing here?
Has something happened?
*: Wh<---> You what!? You've defeated the Archfiend Baramos?
*: Th-Then, by all means, go right on through! Ahaha... You may enter by the main door. I'm sure they are awaiting you eagerly.
